items.name: AI report-stitcher for indie hotels
items.why_now: LLMs can now extract and merge structured data from PMS, CRM, revenue, distribution in one pass; 4 in 5 hotels spend 2 days/week manually stitching. Agentic AI replaces spreadsheet hell.
items.description: SaaS that ingests hotel systems (PMS, channel manager, revenue) and outputs a single weekly ops + distribution report. Target: indie/boutique 20-80 rooms. ACV $2-6K/year.
items.landing_headline: Your weekly hotel report. One click. No spreadsheets.

items.name: AI housekeeping scheduler for sub-100-room properties
items.why_now: Agentic AI can now ingest PMS occupancy + forecasts and auto-assign rooms by floor, skill, arrival/departure. 72% still use spreadsheets; incumbents (HotelOpsAI, Oxmaint) target 300+ rooms. Gap: boutique/indie.
items.description: Lightweight scheduler for 20-100 room properties. Integrates with common PMS. Output: daily room assignments, priority queue. ACV $1.5-5K/year.

items.name: AI content readiness audit for hotel discovery
items.why_now: Conversational search (AI answer engines) will drive discovery by 2026; Mews calls it make-or-break. Hotels dont know what AI-ready content means. LLMs can now audit and structure property content for AI consumption.
items.description: Audit + fix: structured descriptions, amenities, pricing for AI discovery. Weekly refresh. Target: indie hotels preparing for 2026. ACV $1.5-4K/year.
items.landing_headline: Is your hotel ready for AI to find you?

items.name: Guest-request triage engine (revenue-weighted)
items.why_now: AI can now classify and prioritize guest requests by revenue impact (upsell), urgency, sentiment. Not chatbot—triage: route high-value to human, automate low-value. 65% call reduction proven; gap is prioritization by $.
items.description: Integrates with guest messaging; triages by revenue potential + urgency. Human gets top 20%. ACV $2-8K. Target: 30-150 room properties.
items.landing_headline: Every guest message. Ranked by what it's worth.

items.name: Cheatsheet synthesis - Top 3
items.description: PAIN: Report-stitcher—2 days/week manual; Housekeeping—spreadsheet chaos; Triage—guest messages unprioritized. BUSINESS: ACV $1.5-6K; recurring weekly/daily. MARKET: Indie/boutique 20-150 rooms; 72% still manual. TEAM: Solo technical; PMS APIs, LLM orchestration. COMPETITION: Enterprise vendors ignore sub-100. PRODUCT: Report-stitcher MVP = 2 PMS + channel manager → 1 PDF; Housekeeping = PMS + forecast → assignments; Triage = messaging webhook → ranked queue. STRATEGY: PLG trial; first paid in 60 days. CUSTOMERS: GM or ops manager; B2B. MARKETING: Hotel FB groups, HTNG. INVESTMENT: Bootstrap. 90-DAY: 10 discovery calls; 1 manual report deliverable; 1 paid pilot. KILL: PMS API access blocked; incumbent moves downmarket.
